title: Ukraine places orthodox leader metropolitan Pavlo under house arrest
description: The spiritual leader of the Kyiv Monastery of the Caves, whose monks have received an expulsion notice, is accused of supporting Russian aggression.

title: Mike Pence won't appeal judge's order to testify in January 6 probe
description: Pence's testimony could offer investigators a firsthand account of Trump's state of mind in the pivotal weeks after he lost to Biden and further expose the rift in their relationship since the end of their administration.

title: UK to house 500 asylum seekers on barge docked off Dorset
description: The migrants are to be confined upon arrival on a barge off the south coast of England.

title: WHO warns of surge in dengue, chikungunya cases
description: The United Nations agency responsible for international public health says dengue and other diseases caused by mosquito-borne arboviruses are spreading faster and further as a result of climate change.

title: Fractured European left cautiously watches France's pension protests
description: Left-wing politicians from around Europe have been following the protests in France against the pension reform. Though many are cautious regarding the French pension system, they are unanimous when it comes to police brutality.

title: At least four children killed in pre-school axe attack in southern Brazil
description: A 25-year-old man armed with a small axe attacked a pre-school in the southern Brazilian state of Santa Catarina on Wednesday, killing at least four children and leaving four other injured.

title: Italian ex-leader Berlusconi hospitalized, reportedly in ICU
description: The 86-year-old three-time premier has had a series of health problems in recent years, most significantly recovering from Covid-19 in 2020.

title: French minister under fire over alleged misuse of anti-extremism fund
description: A fund set up by Marlène Schiappa after the 2020 murder of history teacher Samuel Paty by an Islamic extremist was reportedly misused by beneficiaries.

title: Lithuania restricts rights of Russian citizens on its territory
description: MPs have adopted new sanctions on obtaining citizenship and a ban on acquiring real estate.

title: 'The Super Mario Bros. Movie': The famous plumber transported to a magical world
description: The film adaptation of the cult video game skilfully draws on all its predecessors.

title: 'The richest man and woman in the world are, for the first time in history, both French'
description: According to a 'Forbes' ranking, LVMH boss Bernard Arnault and L'Oréal heiress Françoise Bettencourt Meyers are the richest people in the world. This situation underlines the strength of the luxury sector compared to the high-tech industry.

title: French unions say meeting with PM about divisive pension reform a 'failure'
description: Elisabeth Borne had said on Monday that she wanted to be 'open to all subjects' that the unions wanted to put on the table, but apparently one key subject was still off-limits: the controversial pension reform.

title: Zelensky arrives in Poland to thank key ally and meet Ukrainian refugees
description: Accompanied by his wife, Zelensky also announced this state visit in advance, making it the first of this kind since the start of the war.

title: In Beijing, Macron says China can play 'major role' in finding 'path to peace' in Ukraine
description: Macron was starting a three-day visit to 'reconnect' with China, after three years of zero-Covid policy and despite Beijing's increasing closeness to Russia in the context of the war in Ukraine.

title: Catan board game creator Klaus Teuber dies at 70
description: The German dental technician created one of the most popular board games of recent decades, which has sold tens of millions of copies.

title: 'Poland's view of Europe at a historic turning point is the opposite of France and Germany's visions'
description: The war in Ukraine has provoked a realignment in Central Europe, causing the emergence of a Poland-Romania-Estonia-Lithuania-Latvia-Finland group, writes 'Le Monde' columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Scotland: Former first minister Sturgeon's husband arrested in financial probe
description: In March, Peter Murrell resigned as the head of the Scottish National Party after trying to cover up the fact that the party had lost 30,000 members.

title: Outgoing Finnish PM Marin steps down as party leader
description: After her party lost the general election on Sunday, the popular center-left prime minister announced she would 'not seek to continue as SDP leader' at the next party conference.

title: Trump plays the martyr in historic indictment marked by media frenzy
description: Chraged with falsifying accounting documents, the former US president, who is already on the campaign trail, is taking advantage of this global media spectacle to attack the courts and motivate his supporters.

title: New Zealand's Ardern delivers final speech to parliament
description: The newly retired PM will be tackling  online extremism in her new role as special envoy for Christchurch Call, an initiative created by Ardern in the wake of the 2019 mosque shootings.

title: TotalEnergies closes delayed $10 billion deal with Iraq
description: The project had originally been signed in 2021 but was delayed due to disagreements.

title: Stromae cancels shows up to end of May for health reasons
description: Stromae, 38, has in the past suffered from depression that forced him to stop performing and did not specify the health reasons that led to the cancellations.

title: Taliban bans Afghan women from working with United Nations
description: The Taliban have extended a ban on women working for NGOs to the United Nations' mission throughout the country, a UN spokesman announced, calling such an order 'unacceptable.'

title: French pension reform: Unions fear meeting with PM will be pointless
description: There is still disagreement between Elisabeth Borne, who doesn't intend to drop the contested reform, and the unions, which demand a withdrawal of the measure raising the retirement age to 64.

title: Tunisia: Shaima Issa, the first woman political prisoner under Kais Saied's regime
description: The National Salvation Front activist and opposition muse has been held for more than a month awaiting trial on charges of 'conspiring against state security.'

title: Macron and von der Leyen visit increasingly distant China
description: On a trip to China, the French president and the European Commission president hope to encourage Xi Jinping to use his influence with Russia to find a solution to the war in Ukraine.

title: Progressive candidate Brandon Johnson elected Chicago mayor
description: It was a momentous win for progressive organizations such as the teachers union, with Johnson winning the highest office of any active teachers union member in recent history.

title: Democratic-backed judge wins high stakes Wisconsin Supreme Court race
description: The new court controlled 4-3 by liberals is expected to decide a pending lawsuit challenging the state’s 1849 law banning abortion. In 2020, the court came within one vote of overturning President Joe Biden’s win in the state.

title: Israeli police raid at Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem sparks  protests and violence
description: After the announcement of the clashes at Al-Aqsa, several rockets were fired from the northern Gaza Strip towards Israeli territory.

title: Alexandre de Moraes, the Brazilian judge on Jair Bolsonaro's trail
description: The Supreme Federal Court justice and head of the Superior Electoral Court is often considered the most powerful man in Brazil. The fate of the former far-right president, who has returned to the country after three months of exile in the United States, is now in his hands.

title: Germany convinces EU to authorize sales of combustion engine vehicles using synthetic fuels beyond 2035
description: E-fuels are being presented by their supporters as a global alternative to electric vehicles but their efficacy and environmental qualities are still in doubt by the scientific community.
